title: [Self-Directed] Experiential Education Program for Occupational Injury Prevention for Massage Therapists

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary human anatomy and foundational massage technique knowledge
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented course for practicing massage therapists to scientifically analyze physical workloads in real work settings and develop improvement strategies.

learning_goals: Participants can identify and explain at least three risk factors for musculoskeletal injuries
Participants can demonstrate massage techniques applying five correct postures through experiential practice
Participants can analyze their own movement patterns and develop improvement plans through reflective journaling
Participants can improve risk indices measured by standardized ergonomic assessment tools (REBA/OWAS) by over 20%

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
